intro: Cieca multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered cieca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, branching stems and small, often hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters that bloom in the spring. Cieca multiflora is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
